evidence_items.text: On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs, communication device records, and witness statements to confirm presence and reachability

children_spec.statement: Communication devices were operational and available for use by the crew
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and device functionality tests to verify communication equipment availability and operability

children_spec.statement: Crew members had access to necessary communication channels and frequencies
children_spec.test_procedure: Review communication protocols and logs to confirm access to required channels and frequencies

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control were physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and physical condition to verify presence and integrity of mechanical control components

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were accessible and not obstructed during operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine cockpit and control linkage areas for any obstructions or access issues during the event

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were connected and properly linked to control inputs
children_spec.test_procedure: Perform mechanical linkage continuity tests and review inspection logs for disconnections or misalignments

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components were free from failure modes such as breakage, jamming, or excessive wear
children_spec.test_procedure: Conduct physical and functional tests on mechanical controls to detect breakage, jamming, or wear

children_spec.statement: Crew members failed to share critical flight information during the operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Review cockpit voice recordings and communication logs for missing or incomplete information exchanges

children_spec.statement: Crew did not follow established communication protocols and procedures
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare crew communication behavior against standard operating procedures and check for deviations

children_spec.statement: Crew coordination was impaired by misunderstandings or misinterpretations of instructions
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze transcripts and crew interviews for evidence of confusion or misinterpretation during communication

children_spec.statement: Environmental or technical factors disrupted effective communication among crew members
children_spec.test_procedure: Investigate cockpit environment and equipment functionality for issues affecting communication clarity

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental markings were physically present at the time of the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine photographic or video evidence and maintenance logs to verify presence of markings at incident time

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental markings were visible and legible under prevailing conditions at the time of the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Assess lighting, weather, and obstruction conditions along with witness statements to determine visibility and legibility

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental markings were maintained and not degraded or obscured at the time of the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance records and conduct physical inspection reports to evaluate condition of markings

children_spec.statement: The environmental conditions at the time of the incident match known hazardous conditions for the aircraft model
children_spec.test_procedure: Review weather and environmental data to confirm if conditions align with documented hazardous conditions for the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD

children_spec.statement: The physical markings and signage in the environment were consistent with regulatory standards and clearly visible
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect photographs, maintenance records, and witness statements to verify if markings and signage met regulatory standards and visibility requirements

children_spec.statement: There were no deviations or deficiencies in environmental or marking conditions compared to previous safe operations of the same aircraft
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare environmental and marking conditions at the incident time with historical data from prior safe operations of the Short Bros SD3-60 N915GD

children_spec.statement: Availability of required pushback equipment at the time of operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check maintenance and inventory logs for the presence and operational status of pushback equipment during the incident

children_spec.statement: Availability of qualified personnel to perform the pushback procedure
children_spec.test_procedure: Review staffing records and personnel qualifications for the shift during the incident

children_spec.statement: Availability of clear communication channels between ground crew and flight crew during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze communication logs and recordings to verify if communication was established and maintained

children_spec.statement: Pushback procedure deviated from standard checklist steps
children_spec.test_procedure: Review the pushback checklist and compare each step to the executed procedure to identify any omissions or alterations

children_spec.statement: Communication between ground crew and flight crew did not follow prescribed protocol
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze recorded communications and transcripts for adherence to standard communication protocols during pushback

children_spec.statement: Use of pushback equipment did not conform to manufacturer or airline operational guidelines
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect equipment usage logs and maintenance records to verify compliance with operational guidelines during pushback

children_spec.statement: Environmental or situational factors were not properly accounted for in pushback execution
children_spec.test_procedure: Evaluate environmental conditions and situational awareness reports to determine if they were considered appropriately during pushback

children_spec.statement: The environmental conditions at the time of the incident did not degrade the visibility or legibility of the aircraft markings
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine weather reports, lighting conditions, and photographic evidence to determine if markings were obscured or faded

children_spec.statement: The aircraft's external markings met regulatory standards for size, color, and placement at the time of the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance and inspection records, and compare markings against regulatory requirements

children_spec.statement: No environmental factors such as dirt, ice, or damage were present that could have obscured or altered the aircraft markings
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect aircraft condition reports and physical evidence for presence of obscuring substances or damage

node.statement: Relevant environmental markings were visible and legible under prevailing conditions at the time of the incident

defeaters: Direct evidence confirming the visibility and legibility of environmental markings under prevailing conditions at the time of the incident
Pilot or witness statements affirming clear visibility of markings

quotes.exact_quote: the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence S1 and S2 indicate the aircraft undershot the runway and damaged a runway light, implying that relevant environmental markings may not have been fully visible or legible to prevent the undershoot, thus weakly supporting the claim is false.

children_spec.statement: The mechanical components showed signs of wear or damage consistent with failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect mechanical components for wear, cracks, or deformation; evidence of intact components would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Control system logs indicate anomalies or malfunctions prior to the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze control system logs for error codes or irregular signals; absence of anomalies would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Maintenance records reveal unresolved mechanical or control issues before the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance logs for reported issues or deferred repairs; clean maintenance history would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components show no signs of wear or damage
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect mechanical components for wear, cracks, or deformation; evidence of damage would lower confidence

children_spec.statement: Control system responds correctly to input commands
children_spec.test_procedure: Test control system inputs and verify expected outputs; failure to respond correctly would lower confidence

children_spec.statement: No evidence of external interference affecting mechanical or control systems
children_spec.test_procedure: Check for signs of external damage, sabotage, or environmental factors; presence would lower confidence

node.statement: Mechanical control components were connected and properly linked to control inputs

defeaters: Evidence showing mechanical control components were disconnected or improperly linked
Maintenance or inspection reports indicating mechanical control linkage issues

quotes.exact_quote: On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to  arrest the descent, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

outcome.reasoning_summary: None of the provided evidence (S1, S2, S3) addresses whether mechanical control components were connected and properly linked to control inputs; the evidence focuses on the aircraft's landing and environmental conditions.

children_spec.statement: Crew members failed to share critical information in a timely manner
children_spec.test_procedure: Review communication logs and interview crew to determine if critical information was delayed or omitted

children_spec.statement: Crew did not coordinate actions effectively during the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze crew task assignments and timing to assess coordination effectiveness

children_spec.statement: Communication equipment or protocols failed to support effective information exchange
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect communication equipment functionality and review protocol adherence during the event

node.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation

defeaters: Evidence showing crew members were absent or unreachable during the operation
Testimonies or records indicating communication attempts failed due to crew unavailability
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items (S1, S2, S3) addresses the physical presence or reachability of crew members during the operation.

children_spec.statement: The procedural deviation was not corrected by the flight crew during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Review cockpit voice recordings and crew actions to determine if any corrective measures were attempted or implemented during pushback

children_spec.statement: Ground personnel did not intervene to prevent or correct the procedural deviation during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine ground crew reports and communications to verify if any intervention was made to address the deviation

children_spec.statement: The aircraft systems did not detect or alert the crew to the procedural deviation during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze aircraft system logs and alerts to check for any warnings related to the deviation

node.statement: Availability of qualified personnel to perform the pushback procedure

defeaters: Evidence showing qualified personnel were available or unavailable for pushback procedure.
outcome.reasoning_summary: None of the provided evidence items (S1, S2, S3) mention the availability of qualified personnel to perform the pushback procedure.
